bank1.slope: (sloping land (especially the slope beside a body of water))
examples: they pulled the canoe up on the bank
at on the bank of the river and watched the currents

bank2.slope: (a financial institution that accepts deposits and channels the money into lending activities)
examples: he cashed a check at the bank
that bank holds the mortgage on my home

bank4.slope: (an arrangement of similar objects in a row or in tiers)
examples: he operated a bank of switches

bank5.slope: (a supply or stock held in reserve for future use (especially in emergencies))

bank6.slope: (the funds held by a gambling house or the dealer in some gambling games)
examples: he tried to break the bank at Monte Carlo

bank7.slope: (a slope in the turn of a road or track; the outside is higher than the inside in order to reduce the effects of centrifugal force)

bank8.slope: (a container (usually with a slot in the top) for keeping money at home)

bank9.slope: (a building in which the business of banking transacted)
examples: the bank is on the corner of Nassau and Witherspoon

bank10.slope: (a flight maneuver; aircraft tips laterally about its longitudinal axis (especially in turning))
examples: the plane went into a steep bank
